comment.author: 24101413@N03
comment._content: The destruction of so many records was a real loss for future generations, though I'm sure no one was too worried about that at the time!

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: People pleaded with them not to blow it and they did it anyway.  A tragedy in the midst of tragedies.

comment.author: 32465819@N05
comment._content: Incredibly depressing ... the ways and loss of war!

non ci sono commenti per questa splendida foto.
PARLA DA SOLA!!!

comment.author: 7419373@N08
comment._content:
Amazing shot of the Four Courts in flames. Have had many occasions to lament the loss of those records. 
Working in the Four Courts myself it's extraordinary to walk through those corridors knowing the history.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/abigailrieley] As Mary Pollard of TCD termed it: "One of the many state paper bonfires throughout Irish history"
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 34883548@N00
comment._content: I've been stunningly unsuccessful in tracing  my ancestry via my Irish great-grandmother, Fanny Holmes...and this is the reason why.  It's an amazing AND depressing shot.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/simply_diann] You're not the first, and certainly won't be the last to lament the destruction...
